Reviews.Title: “Very average hotel with poor facilities”
Reviews.Author: ZT100
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is clean and functional albeit a little tired looking. The staff are helpful but the thing that really lets the hotel down is its lack of facilities. There is no bar or restaurant, although there are some good tapas bars nearby so this is not a major issue. 'Room Service' is essentially a pizza delivery menu so you cannot bill to your room. Essential items to the business traveller such as an iron to iron your shirts are not available, not even from reception. The beds are hard and uncomfortable and the pillows are hopeless. On the plus side (yes there are some), the hotel is cheap and clean. This is maybe all you want!

Reviews.Title: “Just what I needed”
Reviews.Author: Sophie0276
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well situated in the barrio de Salamanca. It's about 25 walk from Puerta de Alcala and we found it practical to get to various sites around Madrid where we were meeting friends. The room was quite large, and the fact that it was an interior room meant there wasn't much natural light, but was wonderfully quiet. If you're visiting Madrid you're not in the room much during the day so light wasn't a big issue, but quiet always is. No noise from neighbouring rooms or cleaning ladies in the morning which is always a good thing. We got a great rate which included 2 nights breakfast, free mini-bar and 5pm check-out on Sunday for 190 Euros. Breakfast is always wonderful at NH hotels, variety of freshly cut and beautifully presented fruit, various fresh fruit juices, variety of breads, cakes and pastries, Spanish tortilla, cheese etc. etc. For someone very picky about hotel breakfasts, NH always get top marks. Like most NH hotels they have an agreement with the local Telepizza for room service, which is fine (and fun) if you just order it once or twice during your stay. All in all, just what you expect from an NH hotel, and comparing with other hotels I've been I think this one deserves 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and wonderful receptionist called Evie”
Reviews.Author: Kim-Boz13
Reviews.Content: Well located hotel, very close to the Metro- Nunez Balboa, and easy access to and from the airport. The shops and restaurants in the surrounding Salamenca area were wonderful. We were greeted by a lovely receptionist called Evie (hope I have that correct), she was so helpful, and in particular gave us a great recommendation for lunch nearby at Farmacia- it was excellent.The room was great, clean and comfortable, and we believed this hotel to be excellent value for money. Breakfast at the hotel was lovely, -great choice of fresh tasty food. Would most certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We dont need more”
Reviews.Author: Matt75013
Reviews.Content: I went to Madrid for a nice weekend with my girlfriend and we needed a nice hotel, well located, clean and not expensive We didnt expect more and this is what we had. The room was clean, the hotel is well located and well connected cause the tube station is only at 3min (30min to the airport), there's plenty restaurant around, the area is quite and it wasn't expensive ! We had what we want

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Piyush47
Reviews.Content: Got a good deal for this hotel, for 3 nights, I will summarise which may help you in making a decision for booking this particular hotel. Great Rooms - clean comfortable and tidy - nice bathrooms - overall good service Breakfast - really great - lots of choice and good value for money - fruits / cheese / meats / drinks and lots of food - replenished every time by the chef. Location - Salamanca area - really smart area - many restuarants and shops nearby - easy walking distance to the main centre - or you cna take the Metro form Nunez Balbao - very close indeed. We arrived at the airport - had two choice - either take a Metro - line 8 to Nunez Balbao - cost €2.50 - ( changing in May 2012 ) or a bus No 200 to Av De America - €2.00 - and last stop and then 10minutes walk. For a good value - get a 3 day pass which works out cheaper currently €13.00 - individual day pass is €6.00 - the pass finishes at 1.30pm at night - so the 3 day pass would be good option. If you get a good price for this Hotel - take it - its not in the heartland of the "tourist spot" - which is nice - as the area is really smart. The only point which was annoying is that they have a WIFI in the lobby - Free but did not work and the reception was not very helpful in sorting this out.

Reviews.Title: “Good Spanish Suprise”
Reviews.Author: RicardoAssef
Reviews.Content: The hotel rate is affordable for similar hotels in the same area. The staff is efficient, rooms are clean and location very central to the shopping district.

Reviews.Title: “OK if cheap”
Reviews.Author: Waterfall84
Reviews.Content: Aug '11 @ 45 EUR the night. Pluses: Room was reasonably big, neat and well-kept. Common areas OK yet a bit more tired. Check-in was quick and efficient. Minuses: Room facing courtyard... VERY dark even in summer time! NO free wifi/WLAN... super expensive! Standard buffet breakfast does not begin until 8.00 AM in summer. Conclusion: Very good for that price but if more expensive during business season, it is easy to find better valued alternatives. Punctuation: 3 stars, with free Wi-Fi would be 4.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special. A bit of a dissapointment for a NH hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Gorkus
Reviews.Content: I am a fan of NH hotels. They are always nice and you can rest assured you will get a nice room and a good meal. The problem is that NH has expanded so much in Madrid that they will turn anything into one of their properties. This is the case here. The building is not new and that you can tell as soon as you go past the Lobby (which is fairly nice, as is the bar/restaurant area). Facilities are old (we got stuck in the elevator in between floors however we got moving again soon!), rooms are darkish and they need refurbishment. Location is OK. Maybe a bit too quiet meaning that there are not that many nice places to go for a bite or a drink. Breakfast is very good though. That remains within the NH philosophy! If all you need is a bed to sleep in that close to wherever you are going, then you might be fine here. If you need to stay for a couple of days and look for somewhere nice to stay, I'd suggest to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for my business stay”
Reviews.Author: code21
Reviews.Content: The reception staff where very friendly the hotel was clean the room was a bit basic but still of a good standard. very limited english channels on the TV but well i was in spain. Didnt think much of the breakfast but the salad i had in the eveing was very nice. Would i stay again im not sure think i would try somewhere else if given the choice. But still no real complants

Reviews.Title: “Good value. Nice location”
Reviews.Author: jefflef
Reviews.Content: Small rooms. Interior rooms a bit depressing. But clean and good location.

Reviews.Title: “expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: Henk001
Reviews.Content: Room was not clean, certainly not under the bed, checking in and out took a long time, hotel needs a makeover / refresher. I paid abt 110 euro inlc breakfast & 1 dink at the bar, no free internet - no value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Kid-A00
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel NH. It was a very nice hotel, located a little bit away from main atractions but with a good value for money proposal. Stayed in interconecting rooms and it was just perfect for a family with young children.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: dushanko
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my boyfriend and we checked in early around 11:30 and it was nice to have the room as we wanted to shower. I spotted hair in the bathroom behid toilet so left this without a complaint, the rest of the bathroom and room was clean. Room was actually very good size with king bed. TV is small, maybe 19 inches LCD, There wasn't a kettle in the room. The minibar was stocked OK. We experienced something which was rather disturbing during breakfast: We entered the restaurant and there wasn't anyone who would tell us where to sit/took our name/room no. We sat down to a table which was for three people. We where asked to move to a table for two in the corner as the waiter said this is table for 4 (it was clearly laid for three) and 2 minutes another straight couple sat there and they were not asked by the waiter to move even though there were tables for 2 available. Again I thought of making a point but decided not to as Spanish are excellent at pretending that they do not understand if they don't want to! With regards to location, I would prefer to stay more central next time as there isn't that much going on in Salamanca. The service on check/in/out was impersonal and slow, but not unfriendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel -good area”
Reviews.Author: Leofab
Reviews.Content: Good hotel ( quality/price) for The area. Nice breakfast, Confortable rooms, internet connections at The lobby.

Reviews.Title: “The only good thing about this hotel is the location”
Reviews.Author: chatoga
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel is the excellent location… We spend 3 nights in this hotel (one long weekend). When we arrived in the hotel, we were told that we had to take a smoking room as we did not specify in our reservation (it was a present) that we wanted a non-smoking room. We asked to change the first room assigned to us because it smelled really bad. We were given a bigger room that did not smell that bad but was part of a double room.. and yes the door was closed but our neighbours came back at 4 oclock in the morning, decided to turn on the tv , speak quite loudly and smoke. All the nose and smoke came through our door. We waited more than half an hour to call the reception. The only solution they gave us was to change rooms at 5 o’clock in the morning. We even had to go downstairs and pick up the key ourselves as the guy in the reception could not bring it to us… and yes the room was finally a quiet and none smelly room… I have to admit that the biggest disappointment was when I came to the reception the next morning just to point out that we could have saved all these misunderstandings if they would have given us our final room or a non-smoking room from the beginning and I did not hear anyone apologise.. it was more or less our fault to have gone through all these problems…. This is what I call great service…anyway… never again this hotel and if you book by nh do not forget to tick the non-smoking field…..

Reviews.Title: “Inoffensive, but demand an exterior room”
Reviews.Author: wellensian
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because I needed to be close to Line 5 on the Metro for work. An OK hotel, reasonably well located in quiet bourgeois area on the edge of the Barrio Salamanca, 5 minutes walk from the Metro. I rejected the initial room offered, looking over a dingy well, and requested an exterior room, which I was given immediately. It pays to ask for an exterior room upon check-in. Typical NH room with wooden floor and good, if slightly cramped, marble bathroom Comfortable bed and good shower with plenty of hot water. The whole hotel has a 1970s feel and will soon need some updating, particularly to the corridors (ill-fitting carpets on their last legs), and to the creacked marble in the bathroms. In particular the Internet connection did not appear to work at all well. For the second week in Madrid, I stayed with NH, but moved to one of their better properties.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: Angie200969
Reviews.Content: We received good service and the rooms were clean. The hotel is in a good neighbourhood in Madrid and conveniently situated- about 10 minutes metro ride to the centre(Grand Via) and about 20 minutes from the airport. The only downside is that there no airconditioning until the summer and some nights were warm but bearable.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but you can find better in Madrid.”
Reviews.Author: HoppyEu
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here for a combined business / pleasure weekend. It was correct for the price, but no more. You can definitely do better, even within the same chain, in Madrid (see NH Paseo del Prado, for example). Plus points: - We asked - and got - a very quiet room (though at the back of the building, with nasty dark view over fire exit). - Clean and well-maintained throughout. - quiet neighbourhood - modern décor - generally smoke-free Pity about: - tiny lifts; - minimalist bedroom / bathroom: no little extras - breakfast room too small at busy periods - unimaginative breakfast: little choice; average quality produce

Reviews.Title: “Nice Business hotel”
Reviews.Author: vkpaul
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with complete requiremnet of business stay.

Reviews.Title: “27C and they refuse to turn on the air-conditioning!”
Reviews.Author: gleann2009
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights during an early heatwave in Madrid in March. The room was dark, there was one window, opening to a courtyard which appeared to be inside the hotel... a very unpleasant view. The worst was the heat and the refusal of the hotel to turn on the air-con. We were told that it's only turned on in the Summer, despite the fact that it was 27 degrees celsius during our stay. We had children with us, our 4 year old complained about being too hot at night. Only for the hassle involved, I would have been happy to leave on the basis of this disgraceful standard of customer service alone. Also, when we asked reception for directions to the Zoo we were told they didn't know how to get there, this dispite the fact that they sell tickets for the Zoo! I would have given the lowest score for service only for we finally came across somebody helpful on our last day. The hotel is central, not very expensive and clean, though the rooms are in need of refurbishment. Mainly however, I'm disgusted with the attitude when we enquired about the air-con and would definately not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: P16
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. Rooms are fine and very clean. Staff are very friendly and extremely helpful. Reception staff were very helpful with providing directions, locations to visit and making reservations with restaurants etc. Breakfast buffet is OK lots of healthy options. Also lots of bars with very good tapas nearby but make a reservation as it is difficult to get a table at nightime without one. Shuttle to airport for €18.00pp but if there are more than one it is easier and cheaper to take a taxi approx €25.00. About a 25 min walk to main tourist attractions but very easy to find your way around..for some reason they decided to have very straight streets in Madrid!! you can't go wrong!! Also very convenient for getting back to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, not greatest location”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravelers4106
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were invited to speak to students at a university in Madrid and they put us up in this hotel. We found it to be very pleasant. The room was clean, well decorated and roomy. The staff was very accomodating and there was at least one English speaking person on staff at all times. It is located away from most the hustle and bustle of Madrid and it takes about a ten minute metro ride to get to most of the tourist attractions. But the metro is very nearby, easily accessible and cheap. In all honesty, the metro system in Madrid was one of the easiest and cleanest systems we've used in Europe. So if you don't mind a little walk and ride to most of your destinations, this is a great value for Madrid. It is also a very fast ride to the airport in a taxi, so it's good if Madrid is the first or last stop on a European vacation. Some words of caution, don't pay the 30 Euro for the 24 hour wireless connection. It is so slow and frustrating, you'll be wishing you just went downstairs to use the business office. Also don't eat the buffet breakfast at the hotel. It's overpriced and doesn't offer that much. You would be better off walking down to a nearby cafe or cafeteria.
